channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A federal judge further halts Trump's radical transformation of government
item.description: In her order, U.S. District Judge Susan Illston said the president may not initiate large-scale executive branch reorganization without approval from ...

item.title: Harvard's ability to enroll international students revoked. And, summer book releases
item.description: The Trump administration has revoked Harvard University's ability to enroll international students. And, 17 books releasing this summer that NPR criti...

item.title: Kim Kardashian robbery trial: verdict expected in Paris
item.description: A verdict is expected in the Paris trial of 10 people accused of robbing Kim Kardashian at gunpoint in 2016. French media nicknamed them "the Grandpa ...

item.title: Trump threatens steep tariffs on trade with the European Union -- and on iPhones
item.description: Trump said on social media that he had recommended 50% tariffs on European Union products starting June 1 â€” and warned Apple's CEO to move manufacturi...

item.title: Memorial Day Weekend travel could break records. Here's how to prepare for your trip
item.description: AAA predicts a record-breaking 45.1 million Americans will travel between Thursday and Monday, mostly by car and plane. Here's what to know if you're ...

item.title: Trump threatens to hit Apple with 25% tariff on iPhone sales
item.description: President Trump said he would impose steep tariff on Apple unless company starts manufacturing some iPhones in the U.S.

item.title: Russian survivor of Leningrad Siege fined for anti-war protest
item.description: Lyudmila Vasilyeva is fined for "discrediting" the Russian army after calling for an end to Moscow's war in Ukraine.

item.title: Trump's battle with Harvard could derail a Belgian princess' studies
item.description: Belgium's Royal Palace says it's looking into "what kind of impact" Trump's move to block Harvard's international enrollment might have on Princess El...

item.title: South Africa crime statistics debunk 'white genocide' claims - minister
item.description: Of the six most recent victims of farm killings, five were black and one white, the latest figures show.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange 780 soldiers and civilians in biggest swap
item.description: The handover of 390 soldiers and civilians on both sides is the largest since the start of the full-scale war.

item.title: Trump threatens 50% tariffs on EU and 25% penalties on Apple as his trade war intensifies
Trump threatens 50% tariffs on EU and 25% on iPhones
item.description: Shares in the US and Europe fall after the US president says trade talks with the EU are "going nowhere".

item.title: Junior ROTC cadet killed in Parkland shooting is honorary West Point 2025 grad
item.description: Peter Wang, honored as a member of the 2025 West Point class, was just 15 when he was killed in the 2018 mass shooting in Parkland, Florida.

item.title: Relatives of Venezuelan detainees in CECOT find comfort in support group
item.description: Mothers and relatives of the Venezuelan detainees in CECOT have been communicating about their loved ones in a WhatsApp group.

item.title: Bones found on N.J. beaches ID'd as captain of doomed 19th-century ship
item.description: The skeletal remains, including a skull, were found on a number of South Jersey beaches between 1995 and 2013.

item.title: Harvard sues the Trump administration over ban on enrolling foreign students
Harvard sues Trump administration for blocking foreign student enrolment
item.description: It comes a day after the administration said it had revoked Harvard's access to student visa programmes.

item.title: Music talent agent among dead after jet crashes into San Diego neighborhood
item.description: The music agency Sound Talent Group says three of its employees died on the private plane that crashed into a San Diego neighborhood on Thursday.
